meanings.definition: A plural noun meaning a pulley or wheel with a grooved rim around which a rope or chain passes.
meanings.sent1: The workers used sheeves to lift heavy crates onto the truck.
meanings.sent2: The ship's mast had several sheeves to help with raising and lowering the sails.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to use the sheeves as a makeshift merry-go-round.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a set of sheeves, smoothly guiding thoughts along their path.
meanings.sent5: The old barn was filled with the clatter of sheeves as the farmers worked.

meanings.definition: A verb meaning to hoist or haul with a sheeve.
meanings.sent1: They sheeved the heavy crate up to the second floor using a pulley system.
meanings.sent2: The sailors sheeved the anchor out of the water and onto the deck.
meanings.sent3: He sheeved the picnic basket up the tree to keep it safe from ants.
meanings.sent4: The crane operator deftly sheeved the steel beams into place on the skyscraper.
meanings.sent5: The determined ants sheeved the large leaf across the ground to their anthill.
